intro: Jatropha hastata, commonly known as the pale jatropha, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a pale green color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into green, spiny capsules containing toxic seeds. Jatropha hastata is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. It is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and unique floral structures.
